channel.title: BBC News - US & Canada

item.title: Storm Ida: Before and after images of US flooding
item.description: Before and after satellite images of the devastation caused by Storm Ida in the north-east US.

item.title: Will deadly hurricane cause a spike in Covid-19?
item.description: Residents and experts fear the storm's damage will go beyond destruction from floods and winds.

item.title: Capitol riot: 'QAnon Shaman' pleads guilty in federal court
item.description: Jacob Chansley had been indicted on six counts for his role in the pro-Trump siege at the US Capitol.

item.title: US Open: Naomi Osaka's title defence ended by teenager Leylah Fernandez
item.description: Naomi Osaka's US Open title defence is over as she falls in the third round to a stunning performance by Canadian teenager Leylah Fernandez.

item.title: Poor US jobs growth shows Covid Delta variant impact
item.description: The US economy added just 235,000 jobs in August, according to the Bureau of Labour Statistics.

item.title: Theodore McCarrick: Defrocked US cardinal pleads not guilty to sexual assault
item.description: Theodore McCarrick is believed to be the highest-ranking US Catholic to face criminal abuse charges.

item.title: Ahmaud Arbery: Ex-prosecutor charged with mishandling case
item.description: A former US district attorney is accused of mishandling the case of Ahmaud Arbery's death in 2020.

item.title: Brazen coyotes terrorise British Columbia park
item.description: Provincial authorities say they will cull coyotes from Stanley Park after a spike in attacks.

item.title: Why China's bitcoin miners are moving to Texas
item.description: Beijing's crackdown on cryptocurrency sends bitcoin entrepreneurs moving to the wild wild west.

item.title: Storm Ida aftermath: 'I can't even count my losses from the flooding right now'
item.description: Residents in the US north-east assess the scale of the devastation caused by Tropical Storm Ida.

item.title: Drake credits The Beatles on Certified Lover Boy
item.description: Lennon and McCartney get a writing credit on the star's new album, which came out at midnight.

item.title: Afghanistan crisis: How Europe's relationship with Joe Biden turned sour
item.description: In many EU circles, the honeymoon period for Donald Trump's successor may be coming to an end.

item.title: Prince Andrew, Bob Dylan, Catholic priests and the Child Victims Act
item.description: Prince Andrew, Bob Dylan, Catholic priests and others face suits after a change in New York law.

item.title: Climate change: Arctic warming linked to colder winters
item.description: A new study connects the heating of the Arctic region to extreme winter weather in the US.

item.title: Canada federal election: How much trouble is Trudeau in?
item.description: Canada's leader called a snap election, but midway through the campaign his party is struggling.

item.title: Texas abortion law: What women make of six-week abortion ban
item.description: Anti-abortion activists celebrate but a doctor who could be targeted by new law fears for the future.

item.title: Mr Zelensky (finally) goes to Washington
item.description: The Ukrainian president pressed by Donald Trump gets his White House visit - and a new set of worries.

item.title: Theranos scandal: Who is Elizabeth Holmes and why is she on trial?
item.description: The former boss of blood testing company Theranos is accused of fraud and could face years in jail.

item.title: Dontae Sharpe: 'My 26-year fight to prove my innocence'
item.description: After two decades wrongfully behind bars, Dontae Sharpe is finally free but there's one more battle to fight.

item.title: Why was this US athlete 'too tall' to race?
item.description: Blake Leeper fought to compete with able-bodied athletes, but his blades were deemed too long.

item.title: Elijah McClain: Five officials charged in black man's death
item.description: Elijah McClain, 23, was put in a chokehold and injected with ketamine after being stopped by police.

item.title: FBI hate crime reports spike to 12-year high in 2020
item.description: According to an FBI report, black and Asian Americans saw the biggest surges in targeted offences.

item.title: Biden's unlikely plan to use roads to fight racism
item.description: An infrastructure package that seeks to address inequality gets a mixed reception on the ground.

item.title: The devastating human cost of rising US gun violence
item.description: Deadly shootings are on the rise in many US cities - poorer and black communities are hardest hit.

item.title: US census: Hispanic and Asian-American driving US population growth
item.description: Newly released data points to sluggish population growth and a more multiracial US.

item.title: Global heating: Study shows impact of 'climate racism' in US
item.description: Black people in the US are subject to double the level of heat stress in cities than whites.

item.title: How US police training compares with the rest of the world
item.description: Amid calls to improve training in the US, we examine how it compares with other developed countries.

item.title: Covid: Biden to continue Trump's Title 42 migrant expulsions
item.description: The White House plans to continue the controversial Title 42 policy to help combat Covid-19.

item.title: 'Our first day of freedom on American soil'
item.description: Adrian Meza and his family from Nicaragua have just been released from detention by US border officials.

item.title: 'Heartbreaking' conditions in US migrant child camp
item.description: An investigation by the BBC has uncovered alarming conditions at a child migrant camp in Texas.

item.title: US migrant camp 'kids feel like they're in prison'
item.description: More than 2,000 migrant children are being detained in an overcrowded camp in Texas ridden with disease.

item.title: Mexico: Risking everything for an American dream
item.description: Thousands of migrants from Central America are making an arduous journey to the US border.

item.title: Children speak of neglect in US asylum camps
item.description: The BBC has uncovered allegations of cold temperatures, sickness, lice and abuse, through a series of interviews with children and staff at US detention camps for children.

item.title: Colombia: Migrants risking it all to cross Darien Gap
item.description: It takes up to 20 days, and can be deadly â€“ but everyday hundreds try to cross the border between Panama and Colombia.

item.title: Guatemala: Suffocated youth unafraid of a deadly journey
item.description: Tougher policies and deaths on the road are unlikely to stop Guatemalans from trying to reach the US.

item.title: Immigration: Is US-Mexico border seeing a surge in migrants?
item.description: Donald Trump says migrants are crossing the border like the US "has never seen". We've checked the numbers.

item.title: Storm Ida: Floodwater pours into New York City subway station
item.description: Videos also show passengers on flooded buses and cars being swept away, after record rainfall from Storm Ida.

item.title: Millions of Americans at risk of eviction
item.description: After a Covid-era ban on evictions ends, millions of Americans are at risk of losing their homes.

item.title: Caldor Fire: Thousands flee as Lake Tahoe under threat
item.description: Traffic clogs evacuation routes as residents and tourists flee from the encroaching Caldor Fire.

item.title: Biden defends pulling US troops out before all Americans evacuated
item.description: Joe Biden defends his decision to pull US troops out of Afghanistan before all Americans were evacuated.

item.title: Bodies of US troops killed in Kabul returned to America
item.description: A "dignified transfer" ceremony takes place at Dover Air Force Base, Delaware, to receive their remains.

item.title: Delta variant: How to keep kids safe as they return to school
item.description: A return to school for millions of children has many parents worried how to keep kids safe.

item.title: Towering twin waterspouts spotted by Florida beachgoers
item.description: Twin funnels forming from the sky to the sea off the Florida coast surprised beachgoers.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Tear up the business plan'
item.description: CEO Secrets: Brooklyn Brewery boss Eric Ottaway says - be ready to ditch your business plan.

item.title: Storm Henri: Lightning strikes One World Trade Center
item.description: The strike was captured as Storm Henri approached the north-east of the US, bringing heavy rain.

item.title: Turmoil in Afghanistan hits close to home in America too
item.description: Christine's husband was killed in Afghanistan - she's horrified by the Taliban's return to power.

item.title: New York officer rescues fallen man from subway train
item.description: A bystander captured the harrowing moments after a passenger fell unconscious from the platform.

item.title: How technology in the air battles fires on the ground
item.description: Planes equipped with infrared scanners are helping authorities take on historic wildfires in the US.

item.title: Canada 'Sixties Scoop': Indigenous survivors map out their stories
item.description: Canada's "Sixties Scoop" saw thousands of indigenous children forcibly removed from their families.

item.title: New Christmas campaign for Canadians held in China
item.description: The campaign is based on efforts around a similar case involving a British journalist fifty years ago.

item.title: New Brunswick outbreak: How a smalltown doctor became a Covid pariah
item.description: After being labelled "patient zero", a small-town physician in Canada was shunned.
